case_id.label: Case ID
case_id.description: Short identifier for the clinical case, used to reference and cross-link individual records across tables and analysis views.

age.label: Age
age.description: Patient age in years at the time of the encounter, often used as a key stratification variable in medical outcome analyses.

sex.label: Sex
sex.description: Recorded biological sex of the patient, typically coded as M or F, used for subgroup analyses and bias inspection.

diagnosis.label: Diagnosis
diagnosis.description: Primary clinical diagnosis assigned to the case, summarizing the main disease entity driving the current episode of care.

primary_symptom.label: Primary Symptom
primary_symptom.description: Patient-reported or clinician-observed symptom that most prominently characterizes the presenting complaint for this encounter.

comorbidity.label: Comorbidity
comorbidity.description: Relevant chronic conditions or co-existing diseases that may influence prognosis, treatment choices and model behavior.

medication.label: Medication
medication.description: Name or class of the main therapeutic agent administered or prescribed as part of the treatment plan for this case.

dosage.label: Dosage
dosage.description: Textual representation of the medication dose and schedule, often combining amount, units and frequency in one field.

outcome.label: Outcome
outcome.description: High-level summary of the clinical course or short-term result, such as recovered, improved, stable or partial response.

risk_score.label: Risk Score
risk_score.description: Numeric score that aggregates multiple clinical factors into a single risk estimate, typically normalized into a 0â€“1 range.
